FuncDef:
The hwtacacs-server command configures an HWTACACS server in the virtual access HWTACACS view.
The undo hwtacacs-server command deletes an HWTACACS server from the virtual access HWTACACS view.
By default, HWTACACS server is not configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of a server.
The value is in dotted decimal notation and must be a valid unicast address.

Specifies the port number of a server.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535. The default value is 49.

Specifies the shared key in encrypted or plain text.
The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive characters in plain text or a string of 20 to 432 case-sensitive characters in ciphertext, question marks (?) or spaces not supported.
The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

Specifies the shared-key in encrypted or plain text, and the configured text will be displayed as encrypted text.
The new password is at least eight characters long and contains at least two of the following types: upper-case letters, lower-case letters, digits, and special characters.
The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive characters in plain text or a string of 20 to 432 case-sensitive characters in ciphertext, question marks (?) or spaces not supported.
The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

Sets the secondary HWTACACS server. If this parameter is not specified, the server is the primary server.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the authentication mode is set to HWTACACS in the port extension system, an HWTACACS server needs to be configured. To configure an HWTACACS server in the virtual access HWTACACS view, run the hwtacacs-server command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The master and slave servers must be allocated different IP addresses; otherwise, the configuration fails.
